data.title: 'Indian 2' trailer review: Kamal Haasan, Shankar whip up socially-charged film
data.meta_description: The official trailer of Kamal Haasan and Shankar's 'Indian 2' was launched today, June 25. The socially-charged film talks about corruption, unemployment and many issues plaguing the country.
data.text:
The trailer of Kamal Haasan and director Shankar's long-pending film, 'Indian 2', was unveiled today, June 25, in multiple languages. Earlier today, the makers organised an exclusive screening to the media in Chennai. The trailer of 'Indian 2' was a mixed bag. With exciting action sequences, multiple looks of Kamal Haasan and the core theme of corruption in place, 'Indian 2' seems to have a lot to offer.

advertisement

The cast and crew of 'Indian 2' launched the trailer at a press meet in Mumbai on June 25. The promo begins with people talking about unemployment, corruption and the failure of system. Siddharth as Chithra Varadarajan mentions that those who loot public money keep looting. He also talks about how citizens express their dissatisfaction on social media and become barking dogs instead of doing their bit.

There's a lot happening in the trailer of 'Indian 2'. We see Bobby Simha as part of the police force, Priya Bhavani Shankar, Rishikanth and Jagan as Siddharth's friends. But, what caught everyone's attention is SJ Suryah's appearance as a filthy rich man.

Siddharth and friends talk about the only man who the public fears. We then see Siddharth and Kamal Haasan's Senapathy fight against corruption. In an important scene, Kamal Haasan's Senapathy utters a powerful dialogue - which goes, 'Gandhiya vazhi la neenga, Netaji vazhila naa' (You take the Gandhian route, while I take the route that Netaji took).

Here's the trailer:

The trailer of 'Indian 2' had a few promising moments, but it is not one without flaws. Kamal Haasan appears in multiple looks, but the prosthetics look patchy on the big screen. Similarly, the content of the film touches upon corruption, which is a recurring theme in Shankar's films. It now relies on Shankar's screenplay and, if he has any more tricks in his bag, to keep the story intriguing.

Kamal Haasan uses his 'Bigg Boss' punchline, 'Odavum mudiyadhu oliyavum mudiyadhu' (You cannot escape, you cannot hide). However, you get a deja vu feeling while watching the trailer.

Director Shankar and Kamal Haasan's 'Indian 2' is gearing up for a grand release in theatres on July 12. The film will release in multiple languages amid massive anticipation.

The film features Kamal Haasan, Siddharth, Rakul Preet Singh, SJ Suryah, Bobby Simha and Priya Bhavani Shankar, and others in pivotal roles. Jointly produced by Lyca Productions and Red Giant Movies, 'Indian 2' has music composed by Anirudh Ravichander, editing by Sreekar Prasad and cinematography by Ravi Varman.
